author: wvalthar
title: chain-lib Token Viewer for everyone
description: Il est courant de devoir montrer aux utilisateurs ce qui se trouve dans leur portefeuille, les jetons, les jetons, etc. La plupart des projets ne l'intègrent pas car c'est difficile à construire.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem that the team wants to solve is the deep insight of a lot of users, especially in NFT game industry. For helping that they can help to attract more users to the ecosystem. Moreover, they also have a detailed plan that most impact on Cardano ecosystem.
But there are no key metrics inside this proposal. For this idea, my recommendation about key metrics they can choose is about the number of wallets will be on, users that use the system, total value in the market... that all will value the Cardano ecosystem and align with the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
There is no team info on this project, but the team provides a GitHub that they're done and will use for this proposal. Hence, this can increase the feasibility of this project. 
Unfortunately, they don't have a roadmap and KPI to show their detailed step-to-step of developing this project. About the budget, the team just suggest the budget based on the work-hours to finish this project in the scope of 3 months.
f6_assessments.q2:
It lacks both basic things for auditing the project: roadmap and key metrics. For helping Catalyst community audit the proposal, the team should give a detailed roadmap with a timeline that is realistic. This proposal doesn't have these things, that's the reason why this proposal cannot be audited. 
One more thing that the team doesn't have here is a detailed explanation about the problem, but they have a brief about the solution they will make. Most of this info is in tech explanation, and does not have any use case and hard to know that is it hard to say that it address directly to the problem.

f6_assessments.q0: This is good idea and proposer provided a clear and concise description in their problem statement. Everything is clearly explained!  The proposer clearly defines statement of a problem within the challenge which needs to be solved. Definitely this proposal can have a positive impact on the Cardano ecosystem if it is realized and if this project is accepted by the people. This idea is very well presented and only through future use by users it can  add a value to the Cardano ecosystem. Because there are no KPIS, Its hard to compare KPIs with challenge setting. It is not able to scale this project due to lack of data.
f6_assessments.q1: Proposer states  necessary experience and claims that he has the necessary experience, but there is no link to confirm that. A link is missing to confirm the records of relevant skills and experience needed to implement the proposal. There is a link to Github but I don't get the impression that this is enough information. the proposer does not mention the team so it remains for us to conclude how he will do the work himself. The budget is shown but it would be good to give the community a better insight into the distribution of funds. A reasonable amount of money is required for this project, but I'm not sure how we can monitor the development of this project due to lack of data. The proposer does not mention the additional necessary funds and seems to be confident in the realization of the project with the requested funds. The implementable plan is defined literally in one sentence and does not give certainty in the performance itself. Details of actionable tasks and order of execution are not given in the proposal, so that data is also missing. There is a realistic timetable to complete the work. The budget is clearly defined and includes paid hourly rates. The proposal clearly explains technical aspects like architecture, language and technologies that are necessary to implement in his project. No risks are mentioned in this project or how the risks will be eliminated if they appear.
f6_assessments.q2: The project mentions the time frame in which the project will be completed but the dates are not shown. Roadmap with milestones and KPIs are missing. Due to lack of data, the community cannot monitor the success of this project.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea is great that can helpful for users and the problem is within the challenge. But the proposer doesn't have any content to show that this project will help the ecosystem, although there is no info about the implementation for a complex project like this. Moreover, they don't have key metrics. I think that the proposer doesn't have much concern to this challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: There is only a short over about the solution this proposal wants to show and an introduction about already-made open-source of the team that can't understand how it can help this project. My advice for this team is to have a good proposal and enough materials for assessing the feasibility they must give info about a detailed plan they will do, roadmap that with a clear timeline of activities will get, clarify team member info, the budget that is reasonable with the plan and roadmap, risk-relevant that team will face off. Technically, this idea of the project will have a lot of technical stuff but they don't describe any of them, including smart contract, protocol... even more in the user point of view including UX/UI, user cases...
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposer provide nothing in this proposal to audit it. 
No plan, no roadmap, no key metrics in this proposal.
There is also no info about the problem explanation and no info to say how the solution can help to solve the problem.

f6_assessments.q0: The project gives solution for users to view tokens in their wallet by building a web component on Cardano blockchain. In my opinion, this tool can help users in the long term. I would like to see more detailed explanation by video or illustration which make it easier for us to understand this proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal do not give a clear roadmap and KPI. And the proposer is the only person doing this project. Although he give some experience background, he do not provide any reference of related work. Therefore  I wonder about the success of this project.
f6_assessments.q2: It is easy to audit the progress of the project on Github. However, the proposer do not give a clear roadmap and KPI which makes it hard for auditing. Also, I would like to see proposer' experience evidence.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is about building a web component to view tokens in a wallet that anyone can use no matter what javascript framework they use, with appropriate filters. This idea is interesting. The problem is clearly described, and explained in detail. The solution is clearly defined, fits the challenge, with clear potential impact in short term and long term.
Therefore, based on the given information, I strongly agree with this proposal's impact, I can rate it with a score of 5
f6_assessments.q1:
Team profile is provided and described enough for understanding with suitable skill and experiences for implementation.  There is no information on demo/pilot, the proposer provided an experience of "creating a previous nft viewer similar to pool.pm" , however, no proof was provided for verification. The budget is provided with items structure and explanations of calculation base. Roadmap (and KPIs), Risk (and mitigation) were not provided.
Therefore, based on the given information, I disagree with this proposal's feasibility, I can rate it with a score of 2
f6_assessments.q2:
There is a lack of information: (1) Roadmap (and KPIs), (2) Risk (and mitigation). Besides, there is no information on demo/pilot, the proposer provided an experience of "creating a previous nft viewer similar to pool.pm" , however, no proof was provided for verification.
Therefore, based on the given information, I disagree with this proposal's auditability, I can rate it with a score of 2

solution: Construire un composant web pour visualiser les jetons dans un portefeuille que tout le monde peut utiliser quel que soit le framework javascript qu'il utilise, avec les filtres appropriés.
experience: Construction du porte-monnaie / visualiseur de jetons pour Novella, qui était l'un des visualiseurs de jetons les plus avancés. SPO, Alanzo Purple tester, Plutus Pioneer 1
